S10.Name: Salisbury
S10.Fate: to Canada September 1942, paid off 10 December 1943, scrapped 1944

S16.Name: Samuel B. Roberts
S16.Fate: sunk 25 October 1944 during the Battle off Samar

S45.Name: Scipione Africano
S45.Type: light cruiser (also known as exploratori oceanici)
S45.Fate: to France as war reparations 1947; struck 1961; scrapped 1979

S48.Name: Scylla
S48.Fate: declared constructive total loss 23 June 1944, scrapped May 1950

S62.Name: Serapis
S62.Fate: to Netherlands in October 1943 as Piet Hein; broken up 1962

S85.Name: Sims
S85.Fate: sunk 7 May 1942 during the Battle of the Coral Sea

S89.Name: Skagerak
S89.Fate: former Norwegian merchant ship Skagerrak I; sunk 20 January 1944 by Bristol Beaufighters of No. 489 Squadron RNZAF

S101.Name: Snowflake
S101.Fate: Sold 1947, converted to weather ship; scrapped May 1962

S103.Name: Soerabaja
S103.Fate: Sunk 18 February 1942, salvaged in 1942 by Imperial Japanese Navy and used as a battery ship, sunk in 1943 by Allied aircraft

S108.Name: Somali
S108.Fate: Disarmed 1956, used as an experimental vessel

S119.Name: Spikenard
S119.Fate: to Canada 15 May 1941, sunk on 11 February 1942 by U-136

S120.Name: Spiraea
S120.Fate: Sold to Greece as Thessaloniki. August 1945

S123.Name: Sportsman
S123.Fate: to the French Navy on 8 July 1952

S125.Name: Springfield
S125.Fate: converted to Providence-class guided missile cruiser 1960, decommissioned 1974, scrapped 1980

S128.Name: St Albans
S128.Fate: to Norway 14 April 1941, to USSR 16 July 1944, scrapped 1949

S132.Name: St. Francis
S132.Fate: paid off 1945, sank under tow July 1945

S137.Name: St. Louis
S137.Fate: to Brazil as Tamandare 1951, sunk under tow 1980

S141.Name: Stalker
S141.Fate: paid off 29 December 1945, sold into merchant service as Riouw

S147.Name: Stembel
S147.Fate: loaned to Argentina as Rosales 1961, scrapped 1982

S153.Name: Stewart
S153.Fate: scuttled 2 March 1942, raised by IJN and recommissioned September 1943

S166.Name: Strule
S166.Fate: to Free French 25 September 1944 as Croix de Lorraine; decommissioned 1961

S169.Name: Sumatra
S169.Fate: scuttled off the coast of Normandy on 9 June 1944 at Ouistreham as part of a "gooseberry" pier to protect an artificial Allied Mulberry harbour built as part of Operation Overlord.

S171.Name: Sundew
S171.Fate: to Free French as Roselys; scrapped 1948

S175.Name: Sutlej
S175.Fate: to Indian Navy as INS Sutlej 1947; converted to survey ship 1955; decommissioned 1978; scrapped 1979

S177.Name: Suzuya
S177.Fate: sunk 25 October 1944 during the Battle off Samar

S180.Name: Swale
S180.Fate: to South Africa 29 July 1945; scrapped February 1955

S183.Name: Sweetbriar
S183.Fate: Sold July 1946; whale catcher Star IX June 1949; scrapped April 1966
